author: ewmsteinebach
title: Pyramid Rewards system

assessments.note: I don't see how a pyramid scheme is aligned with Cardano's purpose, pyramid schemes are popularly associated with fraud and scams and the only description present in the challenge is to encourage old members to invite new members by referrals, this has no indication that be a sustainable model.

I suppose the emphasis here is to boost an influx of new users.
However, I do not think that this fits the philosophy of Project Catalyst. By mentioning a 'pyramid structure', users link this terminology to a Ponzi scheme and that is not a good connotation.
A pyramid structure also means that at some point in time, you will run out of new members and that could endanger the entire ecosystem.
pyramidal system is a plague, cardano don't need this kind of system!
This proposal does not fit this category. we should not promote adoption using pyramids strategies or multilevel marketing. instead we should promote creativity and merit.

There are other interesting ways to bring people to the community and build the community efforts and mission into motion. Perhaps incentive for number of commentary that help proposals could incentivize thoughful exchange of ideas that can improve the process for proponents. Like get rewarded 5 ADAs for flagged constructive comments that bring value on each proposal.
Pyramid schemes are related to scams in general and the ecosystem does not need this

You posted this as a Community Challenge Setting for Fund 6. I suppose that you want to say: How to bring totally new people to the Cardano ecosystem ? You are already outlining a (rather problematic) solution for this challenge. I think that this should be a proposal under 'value-onboarding'. By the way: Pyramid-systems have a VERY bad image in many parts of the world. Legally VERY problematic and bad for CARDANO's overall reputation.
Just no. No pyramid schemes or ponzi schemes or whatever shady buisness.

There is not enough information to judge the feasibility of this proposal. The idea is very vague and the idea of a pyramid system has a popular negative aspect,

There are no references to understand the financial viability of the challenge.

I recommend that the proposer explain his idea in more detail.
Multi-level marketing, in most cases, is a bad idea.

You have not provided any relevant experience. I feel that I have to address that even the modest cost of 2k USD lacks a detailed explanation.
There has not been given any information who should pay for these rewards. And there is no plan on how to implement it.
There is a possibility for anonimity built in the Cardano blockchain. I see no mention of how this would be solved anywhere.
For sure implementing a pyramidal scheme is feasible. Again, I do not see the usefulness in this.

pyramid schemes or multilevel marketing are considered illegal. we should be very careful when dealing with this kind of strategies. I understand the benefit of having as much adoption has we can but we should convince the users to adopt and use daily the cardano network based on unique characteristics and benefits that can bring to the users. we must educate and demonstrate through social media platforms and reviews how easy and safe is to use this platform and make a network effect just like bitcoin has. We need tools in cardano network to solve and facilitate real world use cases. I think it will be ok if those tools can have some kind of referral system.

It has the potential to promote rewards on ways of improving the system in place. Perhaps expand more on the ways of achieving your challenge in a way that is not predatory on bringing people that may not understand the project let alone the ability to bring value to the community in the areas is needed.
Details are not provided on how the proposed system would work.

I do not think that the Cardano community is very supportive for establishing 'pyramid-systems'. This doesn't not match at all with the high ethical standards of this community. As stated before: Would also be VERY problematic from the legal perspective.
The only metric proposed doesn't indicate that it's something tangible, as it is a metric that could easily be manipulated and there is still a worrying association with ponzi schemes.

The only thing I like about this proposal is the metric: "Amount of people referred by a person". Maybe a better Challenge would then be: "How might we make it easier for community members to share and invite their friends to join Project Catalyst?"
Very vague and generic. If I assess this purely as a proposal, regardless the idea, it provides way to few information and the metrics and success criteria seem rushed together.
Number of users will increase organically anyways thanks to the multiple agreements IOHK is setting up. However, it's indeed the only KPI to assess the success of this challenge
idea to forget , cardano don't need that
Again this is not the way to encourage adoption

More clarity how the proposal will ensure value in the community and what key members would be promoted in the process. How their onboarding will increase changes for Cardano and what method the proposal will achieve the goals of making the solution a reality.
The metric needs more thought. If there is a single person with 100 under them is that better than 100 people with 1 under them? I would say not.

I am afraid that the main KPI would soon be: ‚Negative media articles per month'. I strongly suggest to refrain from this idea. History shows, that this gets easily out of control. Cardano is not Tupper-Ware.

importance: Because, looking from a self interested rational perspective people need to be incentivized to bring new people in on a more active level.
success: Succes would look like a system in which people can claim rewards based on the amount of new people they have introduced to the space.
